fields.headline: Off message: Alan Johnson's gaffes
fields.bodyText: 24 September 2010 Predicting the winner of the Labour leadership contest in a Guardian interview: "I think David [Miliband] is head and shoulders above the other candidate … Picking the leader is really important. Get the wrong person and you're consigned to opposition à la 1979." 24 September Attacking the coalition's policies in the same interview: "Imagine knocking on the doors on the Gipsyville estate saying, 'Yeah, your child trust fund's gone and your child benefit's frozen and your jobs have gone and you're paying more for your food because of the hike in VAT.'" VAT seldom affects food. 9 October Asked about his first act as shadow chancellor: "Pick up a primer – Economics for Beginners." 4 December The possibility of making way for David Miliband: "I'd be delighted if David served in the shadow cabinet, and I have no better person to keep the seat warm for." 9 January 2011 Discussing Labour's last budget with Evan Davis on the Today programme: "You'll know it very well. You've probably read more of it than I have." 9 January Talking to the same show about tackling the budget deficit: "We need to get the structural deficit eradicated. We plan to do that by about 2015-16." Johnson later said he had "probably meant 2016-2017". 9 January Talking to Dermot Murnaghan on Sky News about the rate of employers' national insurance contributions: "It's going up by 1%. From 20% to 21%." Correct figure was to 13.8%.
